description: Creates a new job to transform input data, using steps defined in an existing Glue DataBrew recipe.

parameters.name: EncryptionMode
parameters.description: The encryption mode for the job, which can be one of the following: SSE-KMS - Server-side encryption with keys managed by KMS. SSE-S3 - Server-side encryption with keys managed by Amazon S3.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: A unique name for the job. Valid characters are alphanumeric (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), hyphen (-), period (.), and space.

parameters.name: Outputs
parameters.description: One or more artifacts that represent the output from running the job. (dict) --- Represents options that specify how and where in Amazon S3 DataBrew writes the output generated by recipe jobs or profile jobs. CompressionFormat (string) --- The compression algorithm used to compress the output text of the job. Format (string) --- The data format of the output of the job. PartitionColumns (list) --- The names of one or more partition columns for the output of the job. (string) --- The location in Amazon S3 where the job writes its output. The Amazon S3 bucket name. Key (string) --- The unique name of the object in the bucket. BucketOwner (string) --- The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner. Overwrite (boolean) --- A value that, if true, means that any data in the location specified for output is overwritten with new output. FormatOptions (dict) --- Represents options that define how DataBrew formats job output files. Csv (dict) --- Represents a set of options that define the structure of comma-separated value (CSV) job output. Delimiter (string) --- A single character that specifies the delimiter used to create CSV job output. MaxOutputFiles (integer) --- Maximum number of files to be generated by the job and written to the output folder. For output partitioned by column(s), the MaxOutputFiles value is the maximum number of files per partition.

nested_params.name: CompressionFormat
nested_params.description: The compression algorithm used to compress the output text of the job.

nested_params.description: The data format of the output of the job.

nested_params.description: The names of one or more partition columns for the output of the job.

nested_params.name: Location
nested_params.description: The location in Amazon S3 where the job writes its output.

nested_params.name: Bucket
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket name.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The unique name of the object in the bucket.

nested_params.name: BucketOwner
nested_params.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.

nested_params.name: Overwrite
nested_params.description: A value that, if true, means that any data in the location specified for output is overwritten with new output.

nested_params.name: FormatOptions
nested_params.description: Represents options that define how DataBrew formats job output files.

nested_params.name: Csv
nested_params.description: Represents a set of options that define the structure of comma-separated value (CSV) job output.

nested_params.name: Delimiter
nested_params.description: A single character that specifies the delimiter used to create CSV job output.

nested_params.name: MaxOutputFiles
nested_params.description: Maximum number of files to be generated by the job and written to the output folder. For output partitioned by column(s), the MaxOutputFiles value is the maximum number of files per partition.

parameters.name: DataCatalogOutputs
parameters.description: One or more artifacts that represent the Glue Data Catalog output from running the job. (dict) --- Represents options that specify how and where in the Glue Data Catalog DataBrew writes the output generated by recipe jobs. CatalogId (string) --- The unique identifier of the Amazon Web Services account that holds the Data Catalog that stores the data. The name of a database in the Data Catalog. The name of a table in the Data Catalog. S3Options (dict) --- Represents options that specify how and where DataBrew writes the Amazon S3 output generated by recipe jobs. Represents an Amazon S3 location (bucket name and object key) where DataBrew can write output from a job. The Amazon S3 bucket name. Key (string) --- The unique name of the object in the bucket. BucketOwner (string) --- The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner. DatabaseOptions (dict) --- Represents options that specify how and where DataBrew writes the database output generated by recipe jobs. TempDirectory (dict) --- Represents an Amazon S3 location (bucket name and object key) where DataBrew can store intermediate results. A prefix for the name of a table DataBrew will create in the database. Overwrite (boolean) --- A value that, if true, means that any data in the location specified for output is overwritten with new output. Not supported with DatabaseOptions.

nested_params.description: The name of a database in the Data Catalog.

nested_params.name: TableName
nested_params.description: The name of a table in the Data Catalog.

nested_params.description: Represents an Amazon S3 location (bucket name and object key) where DataBrew can write output from a job.

parameters.name: DatabaseOutputs
parameters.description: Represents a list of JDBC database output objects which defines the output destination for a DataBrew recipe job to write to. (dict) --- Represents a JDBC database output object which defines the output destination for a DataBrew recipe job to write into. The Glue connection that stores the connection information for the target database. Represents options that specify how and where DataBrew writes the database output generated by recipe jobs. TempDirectory (dict) --- Represents an Amazon S3 location (bucket name and object key) where DataBrew can store intermediate results. The Amazon S3 bucket name. Key (string) --- The unique name of the object in the bucket. BucketOwner (string) --- The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner. A prefix for the name of a table DataBrew will create in the database. DatabaseOutputMode (string) --- The output mode to write into the database. Currently supported option: NEW_TABLE.

nested_params.name: GlueConnectionName
nested_params.description: The Glue connection that stores the connection information for the target database.

nested_params.description: Represents options that specify how and where DataBrew writes the database output generated by recipe jobs.

nested_params.description: Represents an Amazon S3 location (bucket name and object key) where DataBrew can store intermediate results.

nested_params.name: DatabaseOutputMode
nested_params.description: The output mode to write into the database. Currently supported option: NEW_TABLE.

parameters.name: RecipeReference
parameters.description: Represents the name and version of a DataBrew recipe. The name of the recipe. RecipeVersion (string) --- The identifier for the version for the recipe.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the recipe.

nested_params.name: RecipeVersion
nested_params.description: The identifier for the version for the recipe.

parameters.name: RoleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role to be assumed when DataBrew runs the job.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Metadata tags to apply to this job. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.description: The name of the job that you created.
